statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Drexel 66, George Mason 59
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. (AP)-- Dominick Mejia matched a career-high with 23 points and shot 5-for-7 from 3-point range to lead Drexel to a 66-59 win over George Mason on Wednesday night. The Dragons (8-6, 4-2 Colonial Athletic Association) won their fourth straight by holding the Patriots (7-8, 2-4) to just two field goals during the final 9:17 and hitting their outside shots down the stretch. Drexel's leading scorer, Phil Goss, shot just 2-for-10 from the floor, but hit a timely 3-pointer from the left corner to put the Dragons ahead 58-53 with 3:18 left. Until that shot from Goss, it was Mejia who had kept the Dragons in the game. Drexel trailed 49-45 until Mejia's final 3-pointer started a 15-4 run that kept the Dragons ahead by at least five over the final 2:27. Mejia, a transfer from North Carolina State, is now 25-for-41 from long range in seven games since becoming eligible. Jai Lewis scored a career-high 31 points for the Patriots, who lost their third straight and again left coach Jim Larranaga tied with John Linn for most wins in program history with 130. Lewis, who also had 13 rebounds, scored 16 in the second half and all but four of George Mason's points in the last nine minutes.
